intro: Concocidium gracile, commonly known as the slender bladderworts, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, bladder-like structures that trap small aquatic organisms, aiding in its nutrient acquisition. The plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater habitats such as ponds and ditches. Its leaves are simple and often submerged, while the flowers are small and usually pink or white. Concocidium gracile plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to the food web and maintaining water quality.
